instruction_text:
To fix Windows audio issues:

1. Check audio device selection:
   - Right-click speaker icon in system tray
   - Select 'Open Sound settings'
   - Verify correct output device is selected
   - Test different output devices

2. Check volume levels:
   - Click speaker icon and verify not muted
   - Check volume mixer (right-click speaker > Open Volume mixer)
   - Ensure application volume not muted
   - Check hardware volume controls

3. Restart audio services:
   - Services.msc
   - Find 'Windows Audio' service
   - Right-click > Restart
   - Also restart 'Windows Audio Endpoint Builder'
   - Or: net stop Audiosrv && net start Audiosrv

4. Update audio drivers:
   - Device Manager > Sound, video and game controllers
   - Right-click audio device > Update driver
   - Or uninstall and restart (Windows will reinstall)
   - Download latest from manufacturer if needed

5. Check audio device in Device Manager:
   - Verify audio device shows without errors
   - Enable device if disabled
   - Uninstall and reinstall device
   - Check for conflicts

6. Run audio troubleshooter:
   - Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot
   - Select 'Playing Audio' troubleshooter
   - Follow troubleshooting steps

7. Check audio enhancements:
   - Sound settings > Device properties
   - Additional device properties
   - Disable audio enhancements
   - Test if sound works

8. Set default audio device:
   - Sound settings > Choose your output device
   - Select correct device as default
   - Test playback

9. Check audio format:
   - Sound settings > Device properties
   - Additional device properties > Advanced
   - Try different sample rates and bit depths
   - Test different audio formats

10. Test with different applications:
    - Try playing audio from different apps
    - Test YouTube, music player, system sounds
    - Determine if issue is application-specific

11. Check for hardware issues:
    - Test headphones/speakers on different device
    - Try different audio output (headphones vs speakers)
    - Check cable connections
    - Test USB audio devices on different ports

12. Check audio codecs:
    - Control Panel > Programs > Turn Windows features on/off
    - Ensure audio codecs are enabled
    - Reinstall if needed

13. Reset audio settings:
    - Sound settings > Sound Control Panel
    - Remove all devices
    - Restart computer
    - Re-detect audio devices

14. Check BIOS settings:
    - Enter BIOS/UEFI
    - Verify onboard audio is enabled
    - Check audio device settings

15. System restore:
    - If recently started, restore to previous point
    - May revert problematic driver updates

16. Update Windows:
    - Install pending Windows updates
    - Updates may include audio driver fixes
    - Restart after updates
